intro: [WRONG START] Rosa caninha var. cymosa, commonly known as the clustered dog rose, is a variant of the common dog rose. It is a deciduous shrub characterized by its thorny stems and fragrant pink flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant produces rose hips, which are orange-red fruits containing seeds. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodlands and hedgerows. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for both ornamental and ecological purposes.
